Uses of Package
org.bukkit.loot

Packages that use org.bukkit.loot 
Package Description
com.destroystokyo.paper.entity  
com.destroystokyo.paper.loottable  
org.bukkit
The root package of the Bukkit API, contains generalized API classes.
org.bukkit.block
Classes used to manipulate the voxels in a world, including special states.
org.bukkit.entity
Interfaces for non-voxel objects that can exist in a world, including all players, monsters, projectiles, etc.
org.bukkit.entity.minecart
Interfaces for various Minecart types.
org.bukkit.event.world
Events triggered by various world states or changes.
org.bukkit.loot
Classes relevant to loot table manipulation and generation.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by com.destroystokyo.paper.entity 
    Class Description
    Lootable
    Represents a Container or a Mob that can have a loot table.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by com.destroystokyo.paper.loottable 
    Class Description
    Lootable
    Represents a Container or a Mob that can have a loot table.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit 
    Class Description
    LootTable
    LootTables are technical files that represent what items should be in naturally generated containers, what items should be dropped when killing a mob, or what items can be fished.
    LootTables
    This enum holds a list of all known LootTables offered by Mojang.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit.block 
    Class Description
    Lootable
    Represents a Container or a Mob that can have a loot table.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit.entity 
    Class Description
    Lootable
    Represents a Container or a Mob that can have a loot table.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit.entity.minecart 
    Class Description
    Lootable
    Represents a Container or a Mob that can have a loot table.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit.event.world 
    Class Description
    LootContext
    Represents additional information a LootTable can use to modify it's generated loot.
    LootTable
    LootTables are technical files that represent what items should be in naturally generated containers, what items should be dropped when killing a mob, or what items can be fished.
  • Classes in org.bukkit.loot used by org.bukkit.loot 
    Class Description
    LootContext
    Represents additional information a LootTable can use to modify it's generated loot.
    LootContext.Builder
    Utility class to make building LootContext easier.
    LootTable
    LootTables are technical files that represent what items should be in naturally generated containers, what items should be dropped when killing a mob, or what items can be fished.
    LootTables
    This enum holds a list of all known LootTables offered by Mojang.
